Entities.Name: Cancer Imaging Finding
Entities.Definition: Radiological findings that suggest or confirm the presence of metastatic disease.

Sample Data.Sentence: New segment VI and segment II/III hepatic hypodense lesions are suspicious for metastases.
Sample Data.Annotated: Cancer Imaging Finding: hepatic hypodense lesions suspicious for metastases

Entities.Name: Anatomic Descriptor
Entities.Definition: Describes specific anatomical locations or characteristics in the context of radiology reports.

Entities.Name: Body Part
Entities.Definition: Refers to the specific part of the body where metastases are located or suspected.

Entities.Name: Assertion Status
Entities.Definition: The level of certainty or probability that a finding represents metastasis, labeled on a four-point Likert scale.

Sample Data.Sentence: New segment VI and segment II/III hepatic hypodense lesions are suspicious for metastases.

Dataset.Name: Radiology Reports Dataset
Dataset.Details: Consists of 4,522 computed tomography (CT) reports from 550 patients, annotated to train models for multilabel classification of metastatic sites.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Radiology reports were annotated using INCEpTION, focusing on cancer imaging findings, anatomic descriptors, and body parts with assertion statuses. Annotations were validated by a team including medical oncologists and radiologists.
